sentences.english: Second, the GAP of the unaspirated bilabial plosives is longest.
sentences.chinese: 二是不送气双唇塞音的闭塞段时长最长。

sentences.english: One thing that still doesn't fit right is the de duration of the track.
sentences.chinese: 一个尚不能正确工作的事情是音轨的时长。

sentences.english: This line shows how long each cycle has run.
sentences.chinese: 这一行显示了每个循环运行的时长。

sentences.english: Her long silk skirt rustled as she walked.
sentences.chinese: 她走路时长绸裙瑟瑟作响。

sentences.english: There are no obvious relationship between weakening of the glottal stop and the length of the tone.
sentences.chinese: 喉塞尾弱化程度与入声时长无明显关系。

sentences.english: Don't talk for too long or ramble. Two minutes is the absolute max.
sentences.chinese: 不要讲太长时间或信口漫谈，时长最多不超过2分钟。

sentences.english: In the aspirated situation, the regularity of the length of plosives'GAP is bad.
sentences.chinese: 在送气情况下，塞音闭塞段时长的规律性较差。

sentences.english: The second chapter refers to studies on mono-syllable tone from the two perspectives of pitch and duration.
sentences.chinese: 第二章从音高和时长两个角度研究南京方言单字调。

sentences.english: The historical drama eventually clocked in at three and a half hours.
sentences.chinese: 这部历史剧最终的时长达三个半小时。

sentences.english: It is reported that this 90-minute long documentary.
sentences.chinese: 据悉，这部纪录片时长90分钟。

sentences.english: Both the size and timing of the fire posed a risk to the island’s plants.
sentences.chinese: 这场大火的时长和规模直接影响到了岛上物种的生存。

sentences.english: The Great Recession forced many colleges to cut back on their job-fairs.
sentences.chinese: 经济大萧条迫使许多大学缩短招聘会的时长。

definition: best of the best/collection of the best (of sth)

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
second (unit of time)/arc second (angular measurement unit)/(coll.) instantly
to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
leading (role)/heading list of signatories/leading actors (in a show)/starring
to deal the fatal blow (sports, chess etc)/to score the winning point
to beat easily/to gain an easy victory
to begin/to open/to start/beginning of an event
lit. a good sword always remains sharp (idiom)/fig. (of one's skills etc) to be as good as ever/the old man still has it
